document_title: Testicular torsion: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, treatment
subsection_content:
When the blood transport route to the scrotum is cut off, the twisted testicle can cause severe urticaria. The organ is swollen and at risk of rapid necrosis if not treated promptly. Below are some typical signs that men should monitor and recognize to contact a doctor early: (3)
Sudden and severe pain on one side of the scrotum; Redness and swelling of the scrotum; One testicle is higher than the other; Stomach-ache.; Nausea and vomiting.; Fever.; Frequent urination; Dizzy.; An unusual tumor appears in the scrotum.
subsection_title: xoan tinh hoan.json. Signs of testicular torsion
subsection_data:
xoan tinh hoan.json. Signs of testicular torsion
When the blood transport route to the scrotum is cut off, the twisted testicle can cause severe urticaria. The organ is swollen and at risk of rapid necrosis if not treated promptly. Below are some typical signs that men should monitor and recognize to contact a doctor early: (3)
Sudden and severe pain on one side of the scrotum; Redness and swelling of the scrotum; One testicle is higher than the other; Stomach-ache.; Nausea and vomiting.; Fever.; Frequent urination; Dizzy.; An unusual tumor appears in the scrotum.
